## Section 1 â€” Agent Status Cards (top)
Two side-by-side cards, one per agent (Daneel, Quentin).
Each card shows:

AgentStatusEntry { id, agent, status, currentTask, updated }
HandoffEntry { id, fromAgent, toAgent, task, context, status, beadId, date }

- Match AppTheme (cardBackground, subtleBorder, etc.) â€” look at EpicsView.swift for reference

description:
Session launch currently creates tmux sessions via a custom socket but never opens them visibly for the user. Fix the launch flow:

1. PRIMARY: Launch tmux session in iTerm2 (AppleScript to open new tab/window with tmux attach)
2. FALLBACK: If iTerm2 not installed, use Terminal.app with tmux attach
3. FALLBACK: If tmux not installed, launch agent CLI directly in iTerm2/Terminal.app

Detection order: check for iTerm2 first (NSWorkspace/LSCopyApplicationURLsForBundleIdentifier), then Terminal.app. Check for tmux via which/command -v.

Current issues:
- SessionMonitor.launchSession() creates the tmux session headlessly but never opens a terminal window
- User sees 'Launched session X' but nothing visible happens
- The tmux socket path /tmp/openclaw-tmux-sockets/openclaw.sock may not exist

Changes needed:
- SessionMonitor: Add method to open session in terminal (iTerm2 preferred, Terminal.app fallback)
- AppState.launchSession(): After creating tmux session, also open it visibly
- Add TerminalLauncher utility: detects available terminals, opens tmux attach or direct CLI
- Handle case where tmux socket dir doesn't exist (create it)
- openBeadInTerminal should also use iTerm2 when available (currently hardcoded to Terminal.app)

description: Gateway/WebSocket connection fails when using OpenClaw backend settings. Investigate current AgentBoard gateway lifecycle, compare with OpenClaw reference implementation, and produce a concrete fix plan (patch or refactor) with risk notes.
notes:
Investigation (2026-02-24): Confirmed gateway rejects connect params with missing nonce. Probe response from ws://127.0.0.1:18789 => {code: INVALID_REQUEST, message: "invalid connect params: at /device: must have required property 'nonce'"}. Current AgentBoard GatewayClient.connect passes nonce:nil to buildAuthPayload and omits device.nonce. This regresses AGENTS.md Gateway Connection requirements. Compared with OpenClaw reference (apps/shared/OpenClawKit/GatewayChannel.swift): waits for connect.challenge nonce, builds v2 payload with nonce, includes device.nonce in connect params. No GatewayClient/OpenClawService tests currently cover handshake invariants.
Workspace reconciliation (2026-02-24): validated dirty files are internally consistent gateway/ATS changes. project.yml now defines generated Info.plist with NSAppTransportSecurity.NSAllowsLocalNetworking=true; xcodegen generate reproduces pbxproj delta. AgentBoard-Info.plist is generated and currently untracked. pbxproj also drops stale NewSessionOutcomeTests.swift references (file absent on disk). Build gate passed after reconcile: xcodebuild -project AgentBoard.xcodeproj -scheme AgentBoard -destination 'platform=macOS' build.
Implemented fix in GatewayClient: now waits for connect.challenge nonce before connect RPC; uses nonce in buildAuthPayload(v2) and device.nonce; no longer sends nonce:nil. Also hardened request send race by registering pendingRequests continuation before async send. Added connect-challenge waiter lifecycle cleanup on disconnect/reconnect and timeout error path. Updated AGENTS.md + CLAUDE.md handshake docs to challenge-based nonce flow. Verification: xcodebuild build passed. Full xcodebuild test run blocked by UI/device infra (passcode-protected device warnings); focused AgentBoardTests run still shows pre-existing suite failures unrelated to this patch (AppConfigStore path normalization expectations + ChatSendThinkingTests baseline failures).
Deep refactor pass (OpenClaw-inspired) completed in GatewayClient: added unified RPC timeout handling (default 15s via request timeout tasks), explicit connect-request timeout (~12s), connect-challenge timeout (~6s), and inbound-frame watchdog (~2x tick interval) that triggers reconnect on stale connection. Added robust failed-connect cleanup path to cancel socket/tasks and fail pending continuations without finishing event subscribers. Parsed hello.policy.tickIntervalMs to drive watchdog cadence. Verification: xcodebuild build âœ… and AgentBoardSmokeTests âœ… (3/3).

description:
Add a 'Notes' tab to AgentBoard that shows the daily workspace memory notes and ontology graph entries for any given day.

## What it shows
A date-navigable journal view with two sections:

### Section 1 â€” Daily Notes
Render ~/.openclaw/workspace/memory/YYYY-MM-DD.md as formatted text.
- Header: date formatted nicely ('Monday, February 24')
- Prev/Next day arrow buttons + 'Today' button (disabled when already on today)
- If no file for the selected date: muted 'No notes for this day' empty state
- Render markdown: bold, code blocks (monospaced), headers, bullet lists
  Use AttributedString or a simple markdown renderer (NSAttributedString + down, or manual .font modifiers for headers/bold/code). No external deps.

### Section 2 â€” Knowledge Graph Entries
Parse ~/.openclaw/workspace/memory/ontology/graph.jsonl and show entries
where properties.date == selected date.
- Show Decisions, Lessons, and Bugs logged that day
- Each entry: type badge (Decision/Lesson/Bug pill), title/summary (1-2 lines), project link if related
- Grouped by type, collapsed if empty
- Empty state per group: none shown if no entries for that type

## New files
- AgentBoard/Services/WorkspaceNotesService.swift
  - @Observable @MainActor
  - selectedDate: Date (default: today)
  - dailyNotes: String (raw markdown content, empty if no file)
  - ontologyEntries: [OntologyDayEntry] (type, id, title/summary, project?)
  - func goToDate(_ date: Date)
  - func goToPreviousDay() / goToNextDay() / goToToday()
  - Reads files on demand (no polling needed â€” only reload on date change)

- AgentBoard/Views/Notes/NotesView.swift
  - Uses WorkspaceNotesService (via AppState or as @State)
  - Two-section layout (daily notes top, ontology bottom)
  - Date nav bar at top

## AppState changes
- Add: var notesService = WorkspaceNotesService()
- Call notesService.goToDate(Date()) on init or first load

## CenterTab + ContentView changes
- Add case: notes = 'Notes' to CenterTab enum
- Add NotesView() to tabContent switch
- Add tab button (it already iterates CenterTab.allCases so it auto-appears)

## Markdown rendering
No external deps. Use Swift's AttributedString with .init(markdown:) for simple rendering, wrapped in a Text view. For fallback, just use Text with monospaced font for code blocks detected via regex. Keep it simple.

## Structs
struct OntologyDayEntry: Identifiable {
    let id: String
    let type: String       // 'Decision', 'Lesson', 'Bug'
    let title: String      // properties.title ?? properties.summary ?? id
    let summary: String    // properties.summary ?? ''
    let projectId: String? // related project if linked
    let status: String?
}

## Constraints
- Swift 6 strict concurrency (SWIFT_STRICT_CONCURRENCY: complete)
- @Observable + @MainActor, match AppState patterns
- No new SPM packages
- XcodeGen â€” never edit project.pbxproj; run xcodegen generate after any project.yml change
- Match AppTheme styling throughout
- Build must pass: xcodebuild build -scheme AgentBoard -destination 'platform=macOS'
